questions.explanation:
7. Does the shop open on Sundays?
(A) Yes, at one o'clock. → Correct (directly answers the question about shop hours)
(B) Because we drove. → Incorrect (unrelated to shop opening)
(C) I'd like to return this item, please. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. Where did these oranges come from?
(A) Here's a basket you can use. → Incorrect (unrelated to the origin of oranges)
(B) From a supplier in California. → Correct (specifies the source of the oranges)
(C) That umbrella is a nice color. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

9. Should I make the dinner reservation for Friday or Saturday?
(A) The Beachside Bistro. → Incorrect (refers to location, not day)
(B) Saturday is better. → Correct (chooses a specific day)
(C) A large plate of pasta. → Incorrect (refers to food, not day)

10. Will Dr. Ivanova be late today?
(A) No, you shouldn't have to wait long. → Correct (addresses Dr. Ivanova's punctuality)
(B) It's just under the desk. → Incorrect (unrelated to lateness)
(C) Sure, I can do that for you. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

11. Aren't there locker rooms at this gym?
(A) These socks are quite comfortable. → Incorrect (unrelated to locker rooms)
(B) She teaches an exercise class. → Incorrect (refers to a person, not locker rooms)
(C) Yes, they're on the lower floor. → Correct (confirms locker room location)

12. Who needs a copy of my safety training certificate?
(A) Maksim does. → Correct (identifies who needs the certificate)
(B) You can hang your vest on that hook. → Incorrect (unrelated to the certificate)
(C) No, I'm certain about that. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

13. Could you phone Mr. Feras and let him know we're in the hotel lobby?
(A) Thank you, it was just renovated. → Incorrect (unrelated to the request)
(B) A free continental breakfast. → Incorrect (irrelevant to phoning)
(C) Yes, of course. → Correct (agrees to make the call)

14. Where does she sell her handmade jewelry?
(A) They'll give you a discount. → Incorrect (refers to pricing, not location)
(B) A pair of earrings. → Incorrect (describes an item, not location)
(C) At a store in the city center. → Correct (specifies the selling location)

15. You're taking a business class in the afternoon, aren't you?
(A) Actually, it's in the morning. → Correct (corrects the class timing)
(B) That office is on the corner. → Incorrect (refers to location, not class)
(C) I have the train schedule here. → Incorrect (unrelated to the class)

16. Could I see some sample floral arrangements before I order?
(A) It's for an award ceremony. → Incorrect (refers to purpose, not samples)
(B) A charge for expedited delivery. → Incorrect (refers to cost, not samples)
(C) Certainly, I have some right here. → Correct (offers to show samples)

17. Don't you want to buy the black sofa?
(A) Some customer reviews. → Incorrect (unrelated to buying decision)
(B) We already have one. → Correct (explains why not buying)
(C) I take my coffee with sugar. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the sofa)

18. Do you have this jacket in a larger size?
(A) Oh, I'm not a sales associate. → Correct (addresses inability to help with size)
(B) I've read the information packet. → Incorrect (unrelated to jacket size)
(C) A very large uniform. → Incorrect (refers to a different item)

19. Where did you first learn about the job opening?
(A) Are there any outdoor tables available? → Incorrect (unrelated to job opening)
(B) The door to the building is still open. → Incorrect (refers to physical access)
(C) I read an online newspaper every morning. → Correct (implies source of job info)

20. Should I bring anything to the meeting?
(A) Probably in the conference room. → Incorrect (refers to location, not items)
(B) They were hired by our manager. → Incorrect (unrelated to bringing items)
(C) Do we have enough handouts? → Correct (suggests an item to bring)

21. What was the total charge for the hotel stay?
(A) I'd have to look at the receipt. → Correct (addresses the charge inquiry)
(B) The fitness center is across from the reception desk. → Incorrect (refers to location)
(C) I'll be eating breakfast in my room. → Incorrect (unrelated to charges)

22. Why did you pursue a career in video game design?
(A) Because I have a talent for it. → Correct (explains the reason for career choice)
(B) This is my new laptop. → Incorrect (unrelated to career)
(C) It's on the other shelf. → Incorrect (refers to location)

23. I'd like to attend the job fair next month.
(A) The speech was inspiring. → Incorrect (unrelated to job fair attendance)
(B) Tunji updated the memo. → Incorrect (irrelevant to attendance)
(C) Registration closed yesterday. → Correct (addresses ability to attend)

24. Hasn't anyone called you back for the second interview yet?
(A) A new phone number. → Incorrect (unrelated to interview callback)
(B) Yes, any available position. → Incorrect (does not address callback)
(C) I'm still waiting. → Correct (confirms callback status)

25. How many tickets do we need for tonight's concert?
(A) The theater is on Johnson Avenue. → Incorrect (refers to location, not quantity)
(B) At seven thirty sharp. → Incorrect (refers to time, not quantity)
(C) I'll buy mine at the door. → Correct (implies ticket quantity indirectly)

26. When are they going to decide who to hire?
(A) A much higher salary. → Incorrect (refers to compensation, not timing)
(B) A lot of good résumés have come in. → Correct (implies timing context)
(C) In the building across the street. → Incorrect (refers to location)

27. I had a chance to look over the contract this morning.
(A) Their contact information. → Incorrect (unrelated to contract review)
(B) Early next week. → Incorrect (refers to time, not review)
(C) What did you think of it? → Correct (seeks feedback on the contract)

28. How are the database updates coming along?
(A) I've been really busy with the Williams account. → Correct (explains update progress indirectly)
(B) Some customer addresses. → Incorrect (refers to data, not progress)
(C) She arrives on Wednesday. → Incorrect (unrelated to database)

29. When can I bring these boxes into the warehouse?
(A) Ten in a package. → Incorrect (refers to quantity, not timing)
(B) Thanks-I just bought it. → Incorrect (unrelated to warehouse)
(C) We'll need to clear some space. → Correct (implies timing condition)

30. The market on Fifth Street is closed for a week.
(A) Some new clothes. → Incorrect (unrelated to market closure)
(B) Is there another one nearby? → Correct (logical response to closure)
(C) The price has been marked down. → Incorrect (refers to pricing)

31. Does the company pay for professional-development courses?
(A) Insook helped develop a new product. → Incorrect (unrelated to course payment)
(B) We do have a significant budget surplus. → Correct (implies funding availability)
(C) He's always so professional. → Incorrect (irrelevant to funding)
